reviews.review_msg: This course is a real ball-buster but that's not Julia's fault, as she was just the instructor for the semester, not the course author. I found her to be patient as she taught a really tough, dry, seminar style course to second year students. If you're going to take 261, I think she's about as good a teacher as you're going to get.

Extremely friendly and approachable prof. Very helpful in term papers and exam. Would love to take her class in the future. Course itself was dry and boring, but if you enjoy working independently, then you'll like the class.
Really good prof. The way she explains the assignments makes the course way easier than taking it online. If you have to take cmns261, take it with Julia!

Anis was a great prof for 261. He's a prof that tries to clarify the assignment before handing it out, so that everyone knows what is needed to achieve a top mark.   If you're ever confused or stuck about something, just send him an e-mail and be assured that he'll try his best to help you. Great prof. Great guy.

great professor! he is very open to student feedback, and is willing to adjust deadlines and marking schemes if justified. Feedback is excellent if needed, and he takes a lot of extra time after class to help! A lot of work, but the grade justifies the effort, if you're willing to put it in.
poster presentation!!!

Anis is a very fair marker, very funny, nice guy and really interested in his work. This course is hard, but Anis tries his hardest to keep it doable and fun.  Intense workload, but worth your efforts in research skills. Balances research papers with fun/easy projects.

I had Arthur at CapU. His class was incredibly boring, he is difficult to understand and just reads off his powerpoints...which really have nothing to do with the assignments you have to do. The course pack he makes you buy is useless and was not mentioned after the first class and I never opened it! I would say this is the worst class I've had!

Arthur is possbily the worst prof i've ever had at sfu. does not know material aside from reading it off of the overhead. he is extremely rude to students. how can a school like SFU pay such a useless instructor?

Possibly one of the worst prof's I've ever had. Constantly contradicts what the assignment sheets tell you to do in class - so instructions are very unclear.  And when asking for clarity he is very rude! He has no additional knowledge on documentary research, just seems to follow course notes (that were probably given to him) and makes things up.
this was the worst class ive ever taken, the content was ok but hte teaching skills were non existant

this is a hard class. but i found arthur to be helpful in trying to answer questions of what he was looking for. if you really listen he does repeat and stress the areas in which are important in the course (assignments). i found the course to be challenging but very rewarding.
Everything said already is true. Terrible teaching skills, totally unclear. But both his marking and his exams are insanely easy and you don't need to attend lectures anyway.

He was unclear. Lectures were completely pointless as he just read off the course notes. The guy thought it was hilarious, but in reality he was just annoying. If it can be avoided, do not take this class with him. BOO!

Man, was this ever a brutal course.  He was a good professor though, and I learned lots from that class.  However, he was quite vague in assignment expectations.  I would still take this course over other research methods though.  Course content is really valuable.

Don't take a class with him.  Can't speak clearly; lectures are just reading off the course notes you have to buy; THINK he is humours (and he's not).  Over all, he contributed NOTHING to the course and to the learning process.  Can't record marks properly too (loose assignments / marks).

Reads straight out of coursenotes and tells students that he "didn't grow up with e-mail and therefore won't respond to them."  Assignment requirements are vague, although the assignments themselves sound interesting.

Had him for an online course. When I tried to reach him with a question I was told he was on holiday, and I wouldn't be able to talk to him. Had him for another class, found him to be the most entitled person I've ever met. Also, he makes students buy the books that he's authored, even though they aren't relevant.

The entire course is very labour intensive, never are you not researching and writing for a paper. Final made no sense and expects you to remember every single detail from the textbook while you write non-stop papers. Gutstein has nothing to do with the course besides creating the framework.

The online class is ridiculous. Work load is way above a 200 level, NON QUANTITATIVE course. Consists of 3 assignments (one 6 pages, 2 x 14 pages) and final exam. Assignment guides were useless also. The TA Kevin took over a month to hand back each assignment. Marks were not horrible but definitely inconsistent and not worth the amount of work.

Although Gutstein himself had nothing to do with my experience (because he isn't involved in the distance classes), CMNS 261 was difficult. You can expect a lot of TECHNICAL WRITING essays that are very time consuming. I biffed the first essay because I was trying to be creative - answer exactly what's asked of you and you will be fine.

Worst course I have ever taken. Provide very little guidance. Grading criteria is extremely unclear. I guess it depends a lot on the TA as well. The TA I got was horrible. Extremely bad attitude when you ask her questions. Takes 2 days to answer her emails. Also very unfair marker.

I am really hating this course. The instructions are unclear, we have study guides, library guide, assignment guide, and the guide the T.A wrote us. All give some kind of conflicting info. The tutorial on some of the research is outdated because the websites have changed their layouts. Overall I really hate this course.

I found this class difficult at first but quickly realized that was because I was approaching it wrong. Follow the instructions given to you to write the papers, literally follow them step by step and you will do great in this class. It's to hone your research skills, not to show your creativity. I found Donald very helpful when I was struggling.

This course is unclear and complicated - I don't recommend it. The class average is low B-, and the majority of the students (myself included) have B+ to A- averages. Way too hard and way too unclear.
Worst class and prof ever.

Assignments were time consuming, especially the 2nd one but it's very straight forward. Start working on them early and you'll have no problems completing it. Textbook/courseware is not needed for working on the assignments themselves but make sure you read it for the final exam. The final consisted of details not covered in the assignments.
I only took him through distance education, so I don't know how he is in lecture, but this wonderful man saved my university career with his understanding and helpfulness.

I don't really understand the bad comments here. I was really not looking forward to taking this class because of the comments, but I was pleasantly surprised. On my first assignment, I got 84%. Granted, it is a lot of work and days of research, but it is not "hard" per as; in the distance ed. version, at least, there are step-by-step instructions and even video demonstrations for most parts. I guess it really depends on the T.A.

Had this guy a few years back.  Is the worst prof I ever had.  Lost my paper, tried to blame me, thankfully technology proved I had it complete and ready for hand in prior to due date.  Seems like he has no reason or rhyme to how he marks anything, and he for sure is not there for the students.  Avoid like the plague

I agree with everything said. Took this class Fall of 2008 and I am still seething about being ripped off. I argued every one of my marks for the assignments and he couldn't give me a reason, just stood by his TERRIBLE TA. My marks were post-it noted to my assignments, not even saying how the papers were graded or what they were out of!! Don't take
Very unhelpful, the assignments were extremely vague and lecture and tutorials were useless. You have to teach yourself how to do research in this class. Advise not to take this class!

Did you sign up for this class because you need to take 1 of the research courses? Well after reading these evaluations, drop this class IMMEDIATELY! I thought Documentary research would be easy, since I'm a strong reader and writer. Boy was I ever wrong in taking this course. Very unclear instructions.Horrible TA.No help wutsoever. Don't take it!!

The worst prof I have ever had. Gives you a criteria sheet, and even if you work hard to follow his vague rules, you still might fail.  I regret that he is a teacher.  The course work is much too difficult for a 2nd year course. Does anyone even read those course evaluations?! Dont take this course.

The worst class I have ever taken at SFU. Amount of work is staggering and even then the marks are really low. Taught like a distance ed class with a couple of lectures to tell you about assignments. Not a lot learned other than I would never take a course with this professor again. TA was also unhelpful. Overall TERRIBLE class!

Buy a new pair of shoes and RUN.  Hands out assignment sheets with a due date on them (28th), then emails the class on the 21st and says there was a typo and its due on the 25th. AVOID.  Should retire.
Worst class I've taken at SFU.  I have an A average and got a C in this course.  No help, incomprehensible assignments, and I've been paying for it.  It is teeerrrriiibbbllleeee. AVOID!!!

it's hard to sit through his lectures. He knows what hes talking about but his tone of voice will make u want to sleep. He's a Very hard marker. His standards for his marking are far too high for the sort of instructions we are given.

This professor is the kind of professor that expects you to conform to his standards of teaching right at the beginning of class.  I had no idea what I am doing as his assignments were unclear and complex.  He often has non-mandatory lectures and tutorials so it's difficult to 'learn' more about the assignments that you have to do.

I took this course online and my GPA didn't actually go down  but I had to work like there was no tomorrow three times for each assignment.  Essays are very very long and the instructions were so unclear.  The prof was absent for almost the entire course and didn't even provide a method of communicating with him.

The info in the class was suppose to be useful. Was looking forward to this class, but Gutless made it a horrible experience. As previously stated by someone else, your GPA wil go down. He just doesn't care about the hard work put into papers, with very unclear instructions by the way. Studenst should not accept this level of teaching. I was robbed
The professor sticks with his teaching planing strictly. If you do research outside the scopes he designed, you don't get a mark for it!

His assignments are impossible to do, and very unclear. They require a lot of research (days and days of research!). He is a hard marker, and will take marks off for no reason.  This prof will make your GPA go down.  He is completely useless and unhelpful.  Trust me.
No Comments

The subject matter was interesting and important but the delivery ruined everything. Very confusing and did not have internet access in class for examples but he just brushed it off, so we were left to wonder what we were suppose to learn. Its strange that I get A's in most of my other classes but did so badly in this class. Problem Professor.

Bad, Bad teacher. Everything unclear. He has lost his way in grading, looking for the very worst in every paper instead of focusing on the quality and hard work of a paper. The final exam was useless. Worst class so far. He should retire

Donald Gutstein is a terrible prof.  The class is utterly useless.  I did not learn anything.  He fails a lot of people, and he also sends threatening emails when there is little attendance in his lectures, which are very dry and boring.  The assignments are almost impossible and they take days and days to finish. He cannot access internet in class

Tutorials are not madatory--in fact, sometimes the T.A.s don't even show up.  Go to the lectures because you need all the class notes to study for the exams.  BEWARE--his lectures are sooooo boring and will put you to sleep.  The final exam is VERY detailed--make sure to study hard!!!
No Comments

I was surprised at how much I enjoyed the class and it was becuase of Donald. Get his course notes and follow them, his lectures are a repeat of this. He tries to give you as much help as he possibly can without doing the assignments for you. Definitely start the research asap, or there will be a lot of REALLY late nights. The class is doable.

Gustein's a nice, sweet, shy guy, but his lecture material's really straightforward and boring. Read lecture notes online (lecture is not a necessary) and start researching early! A lot of research is required.
Skip lecture, definitely read the course notebook and follow to the T while doing the papers. Don't worry if you're doing crummy, last paper is a huge booster and final is a cinch
Class was alot of work, but the man has this cute avuncular thing going on and i learned a whole lot.
He's cool and the class is easy. Although there is a lot of work and it's very time consuming.
A horrible class; too much work. Unjustified work load and very unclear on what was wanted.

Lots of nervous breakdown occured as result of this course. I never realized how bad research can be until I took the course. Insane amount of work. Prof, not a bad guy, but it is insane, boring. Take it if you need 3 credits and a nervous breakdown. GL

stupid and useless course! I don't understand why it is one of the requirement in cmns!  It takes lots lots time to do the useless assignment. lots of my friends even cried for it.I hate this course, and it doesn't helpful at all!
Assignments took way too much time to do, and he didnt alter them after students commented on the first one. Boring lectures, but notes were good. Only available once a week for 2 hours to see.
VERY VERY HEAVY workload. all the assignment take A LOT of time to complete. lectures aint useful at all. donald's nice but it's better to take it with a sessional.

Terrible, terrible, terrible. Donald is a decent guy, but the class is... well... terrible. It is very tough to get a decent grade, the assignments take a VERY long time to get done, and not much is gained from them. I suggest you take an alternative.....
Nice enough guy, but boring course and boring lectures.
very nice guy but seriously his course is BORING. lectures are nap times and the assignments are quite a bit of work and boring. the class is dry dry dry.
He doesn't bite, can be alot of work and terribly boring... hardly went to lectures, managed to get the assignments in and got a B.  Final was really easy tho~
Ether-teacher. He knows a lot, but not a very dynamic teacher. If you don't fall asleep in his class, then your better a better man than 99% of the people
nice guy. extremely knowledgeble. boring.
No Comments
He is full of so much information and experience, but his lectures can drag on.
